abstract.p: Correction of September 17 Market Watch column about Nasdaq proposal for new system of handling trades; American Century Investments' Nasdaq trades on electronic communications networks cost far less than those through Wall Street brokerage firms (S)

block.p: The Market Watch column last Sunday, about a Nasdaq proposal for a new system of handling trades, misstated the name of a money and mutual fund management company whose Nasdaq trades on electronic communications networks, known as E.C.N.'s, cost far less than those made through Wall Street brokerage firms. It is American Century Investments; a subsidiary is American Century Ventures.

The Market Watch column last Sunday, about a Nasdaq proposal for a new system of handling trades, misstated the name of a money and mutual fund management company whose Nasdaq trades on electronic communications networks, known as E.C.N.'s, cost far less than those made through Wall Street brokerage firms.
